title: Assur Archive 38
description: In the street from the Tabira gate into the city (bE7I), excavators found a stone with inscription and small archive of 11 clay tablets in a secondary context. The archive may have belonged to a nearby house. Two tablets are dated to 686 B.C, and another is dated to 675 BC. The archive contains documents such as loans, a purchase document, a document concerning the dissolution of a marriage, as well as an adoption document.

properties.description: Representative locations of the Neo-Assyrian archive at Assur on the basis of Peders√©n 1987 Plan(s) 62.
properties.title: Plan location of Assur Archive 38
